channel.title: interesting on kaus.dev
channel.description: Recent content in interesting on kaus.dev

item.title: 🎾🤖 Tennalytix (2/5): Track Pixel Positions Through Deep Learning
item.description: Introduction The goal of this blog post is to describe how I tracked the player and tennis ball pixel locations using deep learning models and how I set this up to run for multiple tennis videos.

item.title: 🎾💻 Tennalytix (3/5): Create Tkinter GUI To Manually Overwrite Predictions
item.description: Introduction In this third blog post, I will describe how I built a user interface with the Python interface library Tkinter. The goal of this interface was to visually inspect player and ball predictions and overwrite predictions where the model went wrong.

item.title: 🎾🏹 Tennalytix (4/5): Create 3d Spatiotemporal Tracking Data
item.description: Introduction In this blog post I describe how I converted 2d pixel data points into 3d space. I highlight how I converted the 3d data points into 3d space.

item.title: 🎾📊 Tennalytix (5/5): Visualising Insights using Plotly Dash
item.description: Introduction We have been able to generate ball and player tracking using deep learning and some transformations to 3d space. But how can we generate actionable insights for professional tennis players?

item.title: 👨‍💼➡👨‍💻 Why I Quit Business For A Computer Science Career
🤓☝ Software Engineering Best Practices For Data Scientists
item.description: Image by pxhere.com Introduction There are some well-established practices in the software engineering community that are less established in the Data Science world. Now that the Data Science community is maturing, these practices get more important in Data Science.
